body_html:
Good idea. The TensorFlow docker images are here. The following commands worked for me:

docker run -it tensorflow/tensorflow:1.4.0 bash
python
>>> from tensorflow.python.lib.io import file_io
>>> file_io.stat('s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data')

I ran this on Ubuntu 14.04 and didn't use any AWS credentials. I don't think the host OS matters, but try without the credentials to match what I did.

body:
Good idea. The TensorFlow docker images are [here](https://hub.docker.com/r/tensorflow/tensorflow/tags/). The following commands worked for me:

```
docker run -it tensorflow/tensorflow:1.4.0 bash
python
>>> from tensorflow.python.lib.io import file_io
>>> file_io.stat('s3://datasets.elasticmapreduce/ngrams/books/20090715/eng-1M/1gram/data')
```
I ran this on Ubuntu 14.04 and didn't use any AWS credentials. I don't think the host OS matters, but try without the credentials to match what I did.
